posts.content:
13th – 15th June
Beacon Farm, Whitby, North Yorkshire YO22 5HS
This is a small family run site with views of Whitby Abbey, the site has toilets and shower facilities.
The onsite tea room sells a good selection of homemade ice cream and cakes, cooked breakfast and snacks are also served.
The village store is also on site and the village pub is next door.
There is a public footpath next to the site so you can walk to Whitby, Robin Hoods bay is only a few miles away and the preserved railway is only a short drive.
This is a pet friendly site, but dogs must be kept on a lead.
The cost is £8 per night and there are a limited number of electric hook up at £5 per night.
All electric hook ups must be booked in advance through myself Tel 01629 580663 or e-mail spares@ssvc.org.uk
Directions
From the moors road A171 Guisborough /Whitby turn right onto the B1416 signed Sneaton. At the end of the road turn right, go over the bridge and up the hill and turn left in Sneaton, Beacon farm is on the left before the pub.

Just let me know if your interested in coming so I can give the owners some idea of numbers.

Sorry for the late notice but should have been in the magazine but that's been delayed.

Would have loved this ,but started new job today and its a bit late to organise.would you on
Pm me next time and we will be there.
I will do my best, keep an eye on the magazine next year and I will list it on the forum.
